profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:42:15 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diaries, correspondence, photographs, writings, scrapbook, exhibition materials, and printed materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: UNMICROFILMED: Two stock books of the Harry Salpeter Gallery, Inc.; 13 bound copies of articles by Salpeter; a drawing; a manuscript of DR. JOHNSON AND MR. BOSWELL; 11 cartoons by Herb Kruckman; correspondence with artists and friends, including 8 postcards and 2 letters from David Burliuk, 1946-1957; photographs; writings, including articles for magazines; a scrapbook; exhibition catalogs; clippings; and books.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 690-691 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Writer, art critic, gallery owner; New York, N.Y.; b. 1895; d. 1967; owner of the Harry Salpeter Gallery; New York, N.Y.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated 1960-1973 by Salpeter and, after his death in 1967, by his widow, Rebecca Salpeter.

controlaccess.subject: Art criticism -- New York (State) -- New York
controlaccess.occupation: Art critics -- New York (State) -- New York
